options.text: To monitor the patient's breathing and adjust the airflow

options.label: C
options.text: To circulate blood throughout the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of mechanical ventilators?

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a standard treatment for respiratory conditions

options.label: B
options.text: To take over the process of breathing when the respiratory system cannot

options.label: D
options.text: To circulate blood throughout the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between life and death in extreme situations?

options.label: A
options.text: The difference between a normal and abnormal respiratory system

options.label: B
options.text: The difference between a functioning and non-functioning respiratory system

options.label: C
options.text: The difference between life and death

options.label: D
options.text: The difference between a healthy and unhealthy body

multiple-choice.question: What is the current limitation of mechanical ventilators in hospitals?

options.label: D
options.text: The training required to operate the machines

multiple-choice.question: What is the urgent need for the world?

options.label: B
options.text: A faster means of producing and distributing life-saving technology

options.label: A
options.text: To provide a standard treatment for respiratory conditions

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: Why can't dogs eat chocolate?

multiple-choice.question: What type of molecule is theobromine?
Which of the following is a result of excessive theobromine consumption in humans?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased heart rate and muscle energy

options.label: B
options.text: Rapid heartbeat, muscle contractions, nausea, convulsions, heart attack, and death

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason pets are more susceptible to theobromine poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: They metabolize theobromine faster than humans

options.label: B
options.text: They have a higher tolerance for theobromine

options.label: C
options.text: They process theobromine more slowly, allowing it to build up in their systems

options.label: D
options.text: They are more attracted to chocolate

multiple-choice.question: How much dark chocolate would an average adult human need to consume to reach a lethal dose of theobromine?
Which species is less likely to get poisoned from chocolate due to its inability to taste sweet things?
What is the lethal dose of theobromine for a medium-sized dog?
What type of molecule is theobromine?
What is the effect of theobromine on the heart?

options.label: A
options.text: It slows down the heart rate

options.label: B
options.text: It has no effect on the heart rate
